page.title: 08AGRICULTURE
page.content: My teacher, two fellow pupils and myself, visited Mr. Ben Dalgarno the local N.F.U (National Farmer's Union) representative in connection with our study on the local farming scene. Mr. Dalgarno explained the political side of farming in the area. For a number of years now, the farms around Fetterangus have been bought up as an investment by the Coal Board's pension fund and are run by one farmer. As a result there are fewer self_run farms in this area than there were fifteen to twenty years ago. Now, with machines taking over more than half the work, fewer people are needed at the farms. He further explained that farmers can be seen to be economising in our area, in other words trying to get more produce out of their hectarage.
